p: Based on the TBARS index, it was determined that the oregano essential oil had the most effective action in limiting lipid oxidation in BAADER meat during 9 months of storage (Table 2). The initial TBARS index value for BAADER meat was 0.306 mg MAD/kg of the sample. Compared to EOS, significantly ( p < 0.05) higher TBARS values were found in D and E40. After 9 months of sample storage, the TBARS index for EOS was 0.118 mg MAD/kg of the sample and was significantly ( p < 0.05) lower than that seen in the other samples.
